dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form
Class SWTTable

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.SWTTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.internal.ISWTWidgetElement, ISWTWidget
public class SWTTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISWTWidget, dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.internal.ISWTWidgetElement

This standard widget represents a table. 

 SWTColumnDescription[] descs = new SWTColumnDescription[5];
 descs[0] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Float", "MEMENTO1", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.FLOAT, 100, "1.1" );
 descs[1] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Integer", "MEMENTO2", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.INTEGER, 100, "2" );
 descs[2] = new SWTColumnDescription( "String", "MEMENTO3", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.TEXT, 100, "abc" );
 descs[3] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Boolean", "MEMENTO4", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.BOOLEAN, 100, "false" );
 descs[4] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Combo", "MEMENTO5", 100, new String[]{"ONE", "TWO", "THREE"}, "ONE" );
 
 factory.createTable(   parentComposite,
                                                IConstants.WIDGET_ID_TABLE,
                                                IConstants.MEMENTO_KEY_TABLE,
                                                "My Table",
                                                10,
                                                descs,
                                                WidgetFactory.TABLE_ACTION_ALL );

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

2008.b

setSorting

public void setSorting(boolean sorting)
Changes the table sorting functionality on or off.

By default sorting is on which allows the user to sort columns.

Parameters:
sorting - true to enable sorting
Since:
2009.a

setSortColumn

public boolean setSortColumn(java.lang.String columnName,
                             SWTTable.SortFlags order)
Changes the sorted column in the given sort order:

Parameters:
columnName - The name of the column to be sorted
order - The given sort order SWTTable.SortFlags
Returns:
true if changing the column was successful, else false (e.g. if the columnName does not exist)

addDragSource

public org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DragSource addDragSource(int style,
                                                    org.eclipse.swt.dnd.Transfer[] transferAgents,
                                                    org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DragSourceListener sourceListener)
                                             throws dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException
Creates a new DragSource to handle dragging from the Table. It is only possible to create one DragSource for each Table. The DragSource will be deleted when the widget is disposed.

Parameters:
style - the bitwise OR'ing of allowed operations; this may be a combination of any of DND.DROP_NONE, DND.DROP_COPY, DND.DROP_MOVE, DND.DROP_LINK
transferAgents - a list of Transfer objects which define the types of data that can be dragged from this source
sourceListener - the listener which should be notified
Returns:
the DragSource
Throws:
dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException - for all problems adding a drag source. Use getCause() to retrieve more information about which problem occured.
Since:
12.0

addDropTarget

public org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DropTarget addDropTarget(int style,
                                                    org.eclipse.swt.dnd.Transfer[] transferAgents,
                                                    org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DropTargetListener dropListener)
                                             throws dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException
Creates a new DropTarget to allow data to be dropped on the specified Control. It is only possible to create one DropTarget for each Table. All DropTargets will be deleted when the widget is disposed.

Parameters:
style - the bitwise OR'ing of allowed operations; this may be a combination of any of DND.DROP_NONE, DND.DROP_COPY, DND.DROP_MOVE, DND.DROP_LINK
transferAgents - a list of Transfer objects which define the types of data that can be dropped on this target
dropListener - the listener which should be notified
Returns:
the DropTarget
Throws:
dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException - for all problems adding a drop target. Use getCause() to retrieve more information about which problem occured.
Since:
12.0
